name: ABC
text:
Thanks to Crayola, children of many different backgrounds can have access to crayons that are reflective of their own skin tone.

The company announced its "Colors of the World" line featuring 24 new crayon colors representing 40 global skin tones. https://t.co/ALTr2kHgKk

text:
Nearly seven in 10 Americans say it's the federal government’s responsibility to provide medical care to undocumented immigrants.

Fewer than four in 10 say it also should be providing them economic help if they’ve lost their jobs during the outbreak. https://t.co/cOVDV99uHz

text:
The Bronx is home to nearly 1.5 million New Yorkers—many of whom are essential workers.

“Before COVID-19, the Bronx was known as the poorest borough,” Councilmember Ritchie Torres tells @ABC News.” “It's come to be known as the essential borough.” https://t.co/Uad3RZfkWb https://t.co/O1MWZW3rkf
